author: {'steamid': '76561198069587753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1568837275}
review:
Amazing game, for those familiar with [i]Princess remedy in a World of Hurt[/i] the game mechanics are similar, a top down bullet hell, this time with more boss fights (that 4th boss tho...) and an intresting dating system that can completely alter your fighting tactics.

Exquisite retro graphics and amazing 8bit soundtrack only add to this wonderfull game, definitively reccomended!


The ending alone is worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009922047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1475878911}
review:
Very similar to the first game, which was free, and I would definitely say I don't mind paying the fairly cheap price. In this game, the Princess is still romantically attracted to virtually everything in existence, but she's dating them to decide what special she gets during battle, as well as a fun scene at the end.

To those who don't know the original, this is an RPG with a battle mechanic like a bullet hell shooter that is supposed to represent 'healing' people by shooting the bejezus out of the physical embodiments of their problems, which sometimes aren't medical problems because this game is weird. Shooting happens automatically in the direction you're pointing, you move around a small arena with obstacles, you have a special power activated by virtually any button that has limited uses and depends on which NPC you are dating. There are bosses that mostly feel more like traditional shooter bosses and also freak me the hell out, causing me to shoot them even more enthusiastically to make them stop existing.

The game has very retro-style graphics and gameplay. I like it because the music is upbeat and the world is brightly coloured and fun, with a science fantasy feel to it. Virtually anything, including ducks, flowers, fires and doors, is self-aware and can speak, and therefore Princess Remedi is attracted to it. The humour gets extremely meta at times. This game gets compared with Undertale a lot but it feels like its own thing. 

The game is very short with one-sentence dialogues that are usually comedic, something that can bother people but in my experience doesn't affect play. There is a large leap between difficulty modes. Personally I suck at shooters and can barely defeat the final boss [spoiler] and secret boss [/spoiler] on Medium. I also find the final boss overly creepy so keep wanting to look away, which doesn't help!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995928059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1475723145}
review:
Nearly identical to the first game (available for free), but the awkward romance has been weaponized. Still only takes an hour or so to complete in full, but additional difficulty levels add some reason to come back for another pass or three.
If you enjoyed the first game and would like a second helping, here it is- simple as that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985116875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1483603000}
review:
If you liked the first one this one is just as good, has the same humour and fun characters as the first!
if you havent played the first one, play it and then this, 2 fun little 1hr games that actually have a more replay value than 90% of games released these days 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7466, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1473678368}
review: A stellar followup to the game jam original, Heap of Trouble reworks the original game by allowing you to swap around powerups and choose how to compliment your weaknesses in playing, so yeah, well worth the purchase if you want a quick, replayable game with a lot of variety and secrets to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971305233', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1475240251}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198014668744', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1547145865}
review:
A prequel to A World of Hurt, this game's got more polish compared to the original game. The game's new selling point, along with the original's shooty-dodgy affair, is a buddy (or dating) system that allows you to bring most of anyone in the game you've healed along for a ride. Some'll heal you, some'll give homing shots, others will give lasers!

The music's pretty decent, aiming to match the intentionally-retro graphics. Whether or not it's accurate is up for the Commodore enthusiasts to decide. Personally, I liked it.

One of the things I [i]didn't[/i] like (and this is very much a minor thing) is that changing direction makes you change fire direction. This makes fighting the infections a little more difficult when dealing with chasers.

However, the introduction of multiple boss fights is very much welcome. Whilst A World of Hurt had one big boss at the end of the game, A Heap of Trouble has many smaller bosses as gate-keepers, whose fights dip their grotesque feet into the stream of bullet hell. Coupled with three difficulty modes (as Remar is wont to do with games he helps develop), A Heap of Trouble is definitely worth the pocket-change asking price Ludosity have placed on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057797375', 'num_games_owned': 1020, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1474777337}

review: Short, but sweet. If you enjoyed the first Princess Remedy game (and if you haven't tried it, go ahead and do so, it's free!), you'll enjoy this too! Meet a variety of colorful characters, help them feel better, and then date them! What's not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561198216009643', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1474391377}
review:
[I]Ever wanted to date a wheeled whale and have it tag along? Now you can![/I]

I really enjoyed "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt", and got this game as soon as I could.

For its price, I think it's worth it.

The changes (gameplay-wise) from the prequel are
~The abilities you gain by dating someone
~You don't heal automatically; you have to shoot enemies which drains their health.
~Area Bosses

Overall, it's a noticeable improvement, both in graphics and gameplay. The world is more animated and colourful, and the enemies and attack patterns are a lot more varied. The dialogue and sprites are charming like the prequel. The change in the way you heal makes it a tad harder, as you can't heal over time by by just dodging. I enjoyed the challenge. The game also a slightly longer, as it took me more than 2 hours to complete (I had beat the original in just an hour.)

P.S. - If you a Touhou fan, you absolutely SHOULD get this one. The final boss's bullet hell patterns were very similar to Touhou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271021748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1474233745}
review: One of my favourite franchises!! I hope there's a 3rd already in the works! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198043897641', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1474069168}
review:
Noticeably improved over 'World of Hurt'. The core is the same, but being able to date literally anyone (a door, for example) for their abilities adds thematic and gameplay flavor, and Normal difficulty is less of a snoozefest. It's like one hour longer than 'World of Hurt', which could be beaten in less than an hour on the first playthrough, and there's a free OST on Soundcloud, so that's cool.
However, when I was playing with a XB1 controller, I found that occasionally, the game would have 'sticky' inputs; that is, when I pressed a direction for a quick tap, it would hold that direction for a second longer than I wanted. This has caused me to eat a bullet I could have dodged more than once.

8/10 it's still a shit game and a friend had to gift this to me before I would look at it

author: {'steamid': '76561198203407209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1636747363}
review:
Essentially an expansion pack to A World of Hurt, which isn't a bad thing. Still, it's more or less the exact same game, and the dating mechanic doesn't really add much-nothing other than healing was ever useful. It is sort of disappointing in having lost the novelty and originality of the first.

That said, A World of Hurt was great and totally free. 2.99 is a steal for more of the same, even if it is just more of the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132019463', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1473947246}
review: I'm glad to see this game got a sequal. I loved the first one, and if you enjoyed the free first princess remedy then you'll enjoy this one just as much. It has the same charming classic looking graphics and same gameplay, but with a few things added in. Such as the partner system. Once you heal someone you can have them partner up with you and they can give you a different speacial move then your normal bomb throw speacial. And boss battles at every heart gate. The music is great again too. So go ahead and play the first one cause it's  free, and if you like it and want more, throw a few bucks to get this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040573485', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1535713502}
review:
ALL HAIL THE MIGHTY DUCKLORD!!

For those of you who have played and enjoyed "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt," you already have reason to get this.

For those who have not, go play the first one. IT IS FREE ON STEAM.

Then come back here when you're done. I know you'll be back in like, an hour tops, sure, but trust me on this.

THIS GAME IS WORTH ITS COST.

I mean, sure, it's more of the same, but with some nice new things to keep it all fresh, and you can date Frallan/Ducklord, so I mean, it's great. Plus you get flask abilities now, which is really cool.

So yeah, this game is worth. Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198292975003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1473615192}

Now, get out there and heal some folks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970560022', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1558119564}
review: Like the first game, Princess Remedy has a great gameplay and a nice, if not very detailed, story with a great sense of humor. It is definitely worth its low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1473543736}
review:
[i]...Can I date multiple people at the same time now??[/i]

[b][i]Princess Remedy In a Heap of Trouble[/i] is a fun little bullet-hell distraction with a lite level-up system.[/b] I finished it in under and hour - so keep that in mind. While I enjoyed my time, I was ok that it was over and it didn't overstay its welcome. This title has very 'lite' elements of [i]Pokemon[/i] and the bullet-hell genre. It never really gets that difficult, which was fine by me.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Price is right, although you can finish it under and hour (84% completion for me; while I may showcase it to other people, I have little reason to play again)
+Controller support was alright (no real complaints, but sometimes it kept shooting 'down', but gameplay is forgiving enough)
+Definately is its own thing, and brings if not something new to the table - a nice collection of previously established ideas
+Music is great

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Meh, other than your companion's powerup ability, the powerups in the chests are meaningless as far as any practicality goes
-The storyline was skippable for me
-Other than the boss battles, you could just brute force through the smaller ones

[b]Totally worth three bucks, and a small afternoon.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198253554208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1584302817}
review: Worth every penny. It doesn't stray from the feel of the first game in the slightest. It's just as much fun and has the same charm and humor, even with the added power up system. Anyone who is a fan of the ZX Spectrum will absolutely love this game. It doesn't just take graphics but has the same spirit and that is exactly how a retro themed game should feel. Music, pace, gameplay, and difficulty is all a solid 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993421349', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1486830181}
review:
This is a lovely little sequel to a great little free jam game, that's also here on Steam and that you should also play. This is basically more of the first one, but with some fun new mechanical tweaks and more stuff to discover. 
It's short, the dialogue is fun, and the battles are bullet-hell-lite. It's not particularly hard by default, but you can crank up the difficulty OR you can skip opening chests to give yourself a real challenge.
It's absolutely worth the low price and is charming as hell so give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2465, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1475636067}
review: I never thought I'd date so many people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067365866', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1514416707}
review:
GAY SPACE PRINCESS 2: ELECTRIC BOOGALOO

it's all the same type of shooting-them-up from the original game, but this time with added variety in the gameplay through the use of abilities gained through "dating" one NPC at a time, which replaces the flask system (although flasks work as the first game if you don't have a date).

the bosses are very interesting to see too; the first game only had one at the very end, although with some kickass music. the only thing this game was missing was some kickass boss music

overall this game is amazing and while some may say complain that it's the same length as the first in a single playthrough, i'm just glad i got to support this series as i absolutely adore it

101% completion (for those unaware):[spoiler]
[u]final final boss:[/u] after defeating the final boss and getting everything else (80 hearts, 5 power, 5 shot, 10 drain, 10 flask) take the eastern exit out of the dead garden. by the way: don't forget to look around for a hidden sign which reveals the bonus mode
  [u]jealous chest:[/u] to open the jealous chest, you must have not dated anyone before on that save file, meaning an all-flask run up to that point. it can be found in a secret area [i]within[/i] the secret area in the castle in moneyplace
[u]each is 1%, do both for 102%[/u][/spoiler]

everyone channel your energy to me so that i can defeat the other difficulty modes

author: {'steamid': '76561198012671752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1473694950}
